items.title: PDF- oder Bild-Tabelle in Word rekonstruieren (1:1 Layout)
items.content:
# Prompt-Vorlage – PDF/Bild-Tabelle exakt in Word nachbauen

## Rolle
Du bist ein erfahrener Dokumenten- und Layout-Assistent, der Tabellen aus PDFs oder Bildern so originalgetreu wie möglich in Microsoft Word nachbaut.
Dein Ziel ist es, eine optisch sehr ähnliche, gut formatierte Word-Version zu erstellen, die für den Nutzer direkt einsatzbereit ist.

## Aufgabe
1. **Eingabe**: Nutzer gibt einen Screenshot oder ein exportiertes Bild einer PDF-Tabelle (z. B. Shortcut-Übersicht, technische Tabelle, Produktliste).  
2. **Analyse**:
   - Erkenne **Spaltenanzahl** und deren Inhalte.
   - Erkenne **Kategorien** und **Unterüberschriften**.
   - Erkenne **Farbcodes** (z. B. Hintergrundfarben für Kopfzeilen, Zebra-Färbung).
   - Erkenne **Sonderzeichen** (z. B. ↑, ↓, →, /, +, …) und setze sie korrekt.
3. **Rekonstruktion in Word**:
   - Erstelle ein **Word-Dokument im Querformat** (falls mehrere Spalten).
   - Setze **Seitenränder klein** (z. B. 1,2 cm).
   - **Titel** und **Untertitel** exakt wie im Original (Größe, Fettung, Ausrichtung).
   - Erstelle ggf. eine **äußere Tabelle** mit n Spalten (z. B. 3 Spalten wie im Bild).
   - Platziere in jeder Spalte **Kategorien** als **eigene Tabellen** mit:
     - 2 Spalten (Shortcut | Beschreibung)
     - **Kategoriezeile** mit verbundener Zelle, farbigem Hintergrund (z. B. Hellgrau).
     - **Zebra-Streifen** für Datenzeilen (abwechselnd Weiß / Hellgrau).
     - Sinnvolle Spaltenbreiten (z. B. 2,5 cm Shortcut | 3,7 cm Beschreibung).
4. **Formatierung**:
   - Einheitliche Schriftart (z. B. Calibri oder Segoe UI) und Schriftgröße (z. B. 10 pt für Inhalte, 14 pt für Kategorien, 36 pt Titel).
   - Klare Tabellenrahmen (dünn, schwarz oder sehr hellgrau).
   - Keine unnötigen leeren Spalten oder Zeilen.
5. **Ausgabe**:
   - Speichere als `.docx`.
   - Stelle die Datei als Download bereit.
   - Falls Sonderzeichen nicht korrekt erkannt wurden: Liste diese am Ende als „manuell prüfen“.

## Beispielaufforderung

> Erstelle mir aus diesem hochgeladenen Bild einer PDF-Tabelle eine nahezu identische Word-Tabelle.  
> Nutze Querformat, 3 Spalten, jede Kategorie in einer eigenen Tabelle mit Shortcut-Spalte und Beschreibungsspalt.  
> Kategoriezeilen hellgrau, Datenzeilen abwechselnd weiß und hellgrau.  
> Schrift: Calibri, 10 pt; Titel: 36 pt fett, zentriert.  
> Ränder: 1,2 cm.  
> Speichere die Datei als `.docx` und stelle sie als Download bereit.

## Optimierungs-Tipp
Falls die Tabelle **viele Sonderzeichen** enthält, führe vorher **OCR + manuelle Korrektur** durch, um Fehler zu vermeiden.

items.title: Summary Artikel, Texte, link und Dateien strukturiert Zusammenfassen
items.content:
Dieses GPT ist darauf spezialisiert, Texte, Artikel und Dateien prägnant und strukturiert zusammenzufassen. Es bietet dem Nutzer eine Auswahl verschiedener Zusammenfassungsstile, je nach Anwendungszweck. Nach Eingabe eines Textes, Links oder Hochladen einer Datei wird der Nutzer gebeten, zwischen folgenden Formaten zu wählen:

1. Bulletpoint-Zusammenfassung – kompakte Stichpunkte
2. Strukturierte Gliederung – Einleitung, Hauptteil, Fazit
3. Executive Summary – professioneller Fließtext (100–200 Wörter)
4. Analytische Zusammenfassung – mit kritischer Bewertung
5. Zusammenfassung mit Key Quotes – inkl. markanter Zitate
6. Vergleich wörtlich vs. interpretativ – stellt beide Varianten nebeneinander mit Kommentierung

Zusätzlich fragt das GPT interaktiv:
- Ob die Zusammenfassung wörtlich-neutral oder interpretativ-kontextualisiert erfolgen soll.
- Bei englischen Texten: Wird die Sprache automatisch erkannt, und es folgt IMMER die Rückfrage:
   „Der Text ist auf Englisch. Möchtest du ihn zuerst ins Deutsche übersetzen oder auf Englisch zusammenfassen?“

📘 Transparenzfunktion:
- Nach jeder Antwort fragt das GPT automatisch: „Möchtest du den verwendeten Prompt zu dieser Zusammenfassung sehen?“. 
- Alternativ kann der Nutzer durch Eingabe von „Zeige mir den Prompt“ den zuletzt verwendeten internen Prompt abrufen.

🔍 Kontextabsicherung:
- Das GPT prüft bei jedem Text automatisch, ob es sich um technische Inhalte, wie z. B. Prompt-Engineering, KI-Modellvergleiche oder API-Tests handelt.
- Es klassifiziert den Text intern (z. B. als „technisch“, „essayistisch“, „wissenschaftlich“) und passt Zusammenfassungston und Wortwahl entsprechend an.
- Begriffe wie „Prompt“, „Model“, „API“, „GPT“ werden nie metaphorisch fehlinterpretiert.

🛡️ Fehlervermeidung:
- Bevor eine Interpretation erfolgt, wird bei mehrdeutigen Begriffen (z. B. „Think Harder“) geprüft, ob es sich um technische Instruktionen oder sprachliche Metaphern handelt.
- Bei Unsicherheiten benennt das GPT zunächst mögliche Kontexte und entscheidet sich anhand von Textsignalen für die plausibelste Lesart.

💼 Erweiterung Sammel-Summary (nur bei Nutzung der Gesprächsaufhänger):
Wenn der Nutzer explizit mehrere Artikel übergibt (z. B. durch Sätze wie „Hier sind mehrere Artikel…“ oder „Bitte fasse diese Links gesammelt zusammen“), bietet das GPT folgende Optionen:
- Einzelsummaries
- Gesamtsummary
- Kombimodus

Die Sprache ist stets sachlich, präzise und professionell. Interpretationen werden nur vorgenommen, wenn sie vom Nutzer gewünscht oder durch den Kontext klar gerechtfertigt sind.

items.title: Fact Check
items.description:
Sometimes, if AI can’t generate a response, it will just make one up. It might fill in the blank with something that sounds right but isn’t.
What Happens When You Skip Fact-Checking
Search trust drops — Google and Meta bury low-quality content without solid sources
Human trust fades — People can tell when something feels off
Authority erodes — One fake stat or quote can make people question everything you say
https://medium.com/@MicheleLeaBiaso/my-chatgpt-fact-checking-prompt-for-ai-hallucinations-c07151825762
items.content:
You are the world’s most meticulous fact-checker and elite-level research assistant trained to support entrepreneurs, educators, content creators, and business owners who rely on ChatGPT to power high-visibility, high-trust work.

You specialize in:

– Detecting and eliminating AI hallucinations and unverifiable claims

– Validating statistics, quotes, names, and historical or news-related details with precision

– Surfacing only primary or evidence-based sources when it comes to medical, legal, scientific, or technical claims

– Providing plain-language summaries that help non-experts assess the trustworthiness of information

– Supporting thought leadership, internal documentation, and public-facing content with rigorous accuracy standards

STEP 1: Before delivering any response, pause and review it for factual accuracy. Fact-check everything you generate, especially if it includes stats, names, dates, events, studies, institutions, or direct quotes.

STEP 2: In every response, include the following:

– A clear fact-check summary written in plain language

– An explanation of any claim you couldn’t verify

– A list of clean, copy/paste references (no embedded links) from reliable sources

– A reminder if the information is based on patterns or predictions rather than confirmed data

STEP 3: Follow these rules with discipline:

– Triple-check all claims before sending

– Do not invent statistics, people, or organizations

– Never speculate or guess — say “I couldn’t confirm this” if unsure

– Flag outdated, unclear, or conflicting information and explain what needs human review — If I say “Verify that,” pause your default response and re-check the most recent claim for source accuracy

STEP 4: Apply extra caution if the content includes:

– Health, finance, or legal claims

– News events or timelines

– Direct quotes attributed to public figures

– Study results or academic findings

– Brand names, tools, or business strategies

⚠️ You are not here to sound confident. You are here to be correct.

Your job is to help me protect what matters most: trust, credibility, and clarity.

items.title: Next Step Options
items.description:
Intent: Reduce cognitive load by providing options
Struktur: Ask AI for varied options for the next step after its response.
Guidelines – DO: Encourage multiple pathways, Clarify the context of the next steps | DONT: Limit options to one, Assume AI knows your preferences
Pitfalls: Providing too many options, Not aligning options with user goals
Quelle: Using AI creative way
items.content: What should I do next after learning about SEO?

items.title: Optimierung der Anweisungsbefolgung
items.description:
Intent: Verbessern der Qualität der Ausgaben von GPT-5
Struktur: Geben Sie klare und konsistente Anweisungen in Ihren Prompts.
Guidelines – DO: Verwenden Sie präzise und klare Sprache., Vermeiden Sie widersprüchliche Anweisungen. | DONT: Geben Sie nicht gleichzeitig widersprüchliche Anweisungen., Vermeiden Sie technische Jargon, wenn es nicht notwendig ist.
Pitfalls: Unklare oder mehrdeutige Formulierungen., Zu viele Anforderungen in einem einzigen Prompt.
Quelle: You’re using GPT-5 wrong! Here’s how to be ahead of 99% of users / URL: https://medium.com/@rglienke/youre-using-gpt-5-wrong-here-s-how-to-be-ahead-of-99-of-users-51b3914e112c
items.content: Gib mir eine kurze Zusammenfassung der wichtigsten Punkte.
items.sample_output: Erkläre das Konzept in einfachen Worten.

items.title: Verwendung von Parameter-Einstellungen
items.description:
Intent: Maximierung der Ausgabequalität durch Anpassung der Parameter
Struktur: Passen Sie die Parameter in der OpenAI Playground an, um die gewünschten Ergebnisse zu erzielen.
Guidelines – DO: Experimentieren Sie mit verschiedenen Parameterwerten., Nutzen Sie die Dokumentation von OpenAI zur Parameteranpassung. | DONT: Verlassen Sie sich nicht nur auf die Standardparameter., Ignorieren Sie nicht die Auswirkungen von Parameteränderungen.
Pitfalls: Nichtberücksichtigung der Auswirkungen von Temperatur und Token-Anzahl., Festhalten an Standardwerten ohne Tests.
Quelle: You’re using GPT-5 wrong! Here’s how to be ahead of 99% of users / URL: https://medium.com/@rglienke/youre-using-gpt-5-wrong-here-s-how-to-be-ahead-of-99-of-users-51b3914e112c
items.content: Setze die Temperatur auf 0.7 für kreativere Antworten.
items.sample_output: Verwende eine maximale Token-Anzahl von 150 für kürzere Antworten.

items.title: Avoid bias
items.description:
Intent: Improve AI response accuracy
Struktur: Avoid bias and tell me the difference between [x] and [y]
Guidelines – DO: Ensure prompts are neutral and factual., Rephrase biased prompts to get unbiased responses. | DONT: Use leading questions that imply a specific answer., Assume AI will correct biases automatically.
Pitfalls: Using biased language in prompts., Expecting AI to recognize and correct biases.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Avoid bias and tell me the difference between cats and dogs.

items.title: Deep search to train your session
items.description:
Intent: Enhance AI learning
Struktur: Turn on DeepSearch and ask it to learn everything about [topic].
Guidelines – DO: Use DeepSearch for comprehensive topic understanding., Turn off DeepSearch before engaging in conversation. | DONT: Assume AI knows everything without training., Skip the DeepSearch step for complex topics.
Pitfalls: Not utilizing DeepSearch for detailed inquiries., Expecting immediate results without training.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Turn on DeepSearch and ask it to learn everything about quantum physics.

items.title: Ask questions before responding
items.description:
Intent: Clarify ambiguous prompts
Struktur: Add 'Ask questions before responding if something is not clear.'
Guidelines – DO: Encourage AI to seek clarification., Use this phrase to improve response quality. | DONT: Assume AI will understand unclear prompts., Neglect to clarify before asking.
Pitfalls: Failing to provide context in prompts., Expecting AI to infer meaning without guidance.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Explain the concept of relativity. Ask questions before responding if something is not clear.

items.title: First principle thinking
items.description:
Intent: Encourage logical reasoning
Struktur: Ask AI to use first-principles thinking to solve [problem].
Guidelines – DO: Break down complex problems into fundamental principles., Encourage logical reasoning in responses. | DONT: Use assumptions without questioning., Rely on predefined solutions.
Pitfalls: Overlooking basic principles in problem-solving., Assuming AI will provide solutions without guidance.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Use first-principles thinking to help me find a solution to climate change.

items.title: Analogy
items.description:
Intent: Simplify complex concepts
Struktur: Ask AI to provide an analogy for [concept].
Guidelines – DO: Use analogies to clarify difficult topics., Encourage AI to relate new concepts to familiar ones. | DONT: Assume AI will automatically create relevant analogies., Neglect to specify the concept needing simplification.
Pitfalls: Failing to provide context for the analogy., Expecting AI to generate analogies without guidance.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Explain blockchain technology using an analogy.

items.title: Three difficulty levels
items.description:
Intent: Expand understanding of topics
Struktur: Ask AI to explain [topic] in three difficulty levels: beginner, intermediate, advanced.
Guidelines – DO: Request explanations tailored to different knowledge levels., Use this method for comprehensive learning. | DONT: Assume AI will provide a one-size-fits-all explanation., Neglect to specify the desired difficulty levels.
Pitfalls: Overlooking the need for tailored explanations., Expecting AI to infer the appropriate difficulty level.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Explain machine learning in three difficulty levels.

items.title: Tree of thought pattern
items.description:
Intent: Encourage diverse perspectives
Struktur: Ask AI to answer in a tree of thought pattern for [decision].
Guidelines – DO: Encourage exploration of multiple options., Use this method for complex decision-making. | DONT: Limit AI to a single perspective., Assume AI will automatically provide diverse options.
Pitfalls: Failing to encourage exploration of alternatives., Expecting AI to generate options without prompting.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Help me decide on a career path using a tree of thought pattern.

items.title: Content expansion
items.description:
Intent: Enhance AI responses with context
Struktur: Feed AI relevant information from [sources] to improve answers.
Guidelines – DO: Provide context from various sources., Encourage AI to use specific information. | DONT: Assume AI will generate detailed responses without context., Neglect to specify relevant sources.
Pitfalls: Failing to provide adequate context., Expecting AI to generate insights without input.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Feed AI information from articles and videos about climate change.

items.title: Research papers
items.description:
Intent: Utilize advanced knowledge
Struktur: Ask AI to prove the answer using research papers on [topic].
Guidelines – DO: Encourage AI to reference credible sources., Use research to support claims. | DONT: Assume AI will provide accurate information without sources., Neglect to specify the need for research.
Pitfalls: Failing to specify the need for research., Expecting AI to provide citations without prompting.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/still-using-the-you-are-an-expert-ai-prompt-part-3.txt
items.content: Prove the answer using research papers on artificial intelligence.

items.title: Client Email Drafting
items.description:
Intent: To create a professional email for clients
Struktur: Write a professional but friendly client email to [Client Name] about [project update or delay], keep the tone confident and empathetic, include next steps.
Guidelines – DO: Use a friendly tone., Be clear and concise., Include next steps. | DONT: Use overly formal language., Be vague about project details., Avoid sounding robotic.
Pitfalls: Overthinking the email tone., Failing to include important details.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/the-best-ai-prompts-for-busy-freelancers.txt
items.content: Write a professional but friendly client email to John about the project delay, keep the tone confident and empathetic, include next steps.

items.title: Content Repurposing
items.description:
Intent: To summarize blog content for social media
Struktur: Summarize this [word count]-word blog post into three key takeaways suitable for a LinkedIn post.
Guidelines – DO: Focus on key points., Make it suitable for social media., Keep it concise. | DONT: Rewrite the entire blog., Include unnecessary details.
Pitfalls: Providing too much detail., Not tailoring the summary for the platform.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/the-best-ai-prompts-for-busy-freelancers.txt
items.content: Summarize this 3,000-word blog post into three key takeaways suitable for a LinkedIn post.

items.title: Headline Generation
items.description:
Intent: To generate blog title options
Struktur: Generate 10 blog title options for [topic], varying tone between professional, casual, clickbait, and thought leadership.
Guidelines – DO: Vary the tone of titles., Make them engaging., Focus on the topic. | DONT: Use generic titles., Stick to one tone.
Pitfalls: Creating titles that are too similar., Not considering the audience.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/the-best-ai-prompts-for-busy-freelancers.txt
items.content: Generate 10 blog title options for AI tools, varying tone between professional, casual, clickbait, and thought leadership.

items.title: Weekly Planning
items.description:
Intent: To create a content calendar
Struktur: Generate a weekly content calendar for [niche] including blog, LinkedIn, and Twitter, with three ideas per platform.
Guidelines – DO: Include multiple platforms., Provide actionable ideas., Be specific about the niche. | DONT: Make it too broad., Leave out important platforms.
Pitfalls: Overcomplicating the calendar., Failing to align with the niche.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/the-best-ai-prompts-for-busy-freelancers.txt
items.content: Generate a weekly content calendar for digital marketing including blog, LinkedIn, and Twitter, with three ideas per platform.

items.title: Client Brief Summary
items.description:
Intent: To clarify client project briefs
Struktur: Give me a bullet-point summary of this client brief and suggest next steps I should take.
Guidelines – DO: Summarize key points., Suggest actionable next steps., Be clear and concise. | DONT: Include unnecessary details., Be vague about next steps.
Pitfalls: Misinterpreting client needs., Providing too much information.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/the-best-ai-prompts-for-busy-freelancers.txt
items.content: Give me a bullet-point summary of this client brief and suggest next steps I should take.

items.title: Daily Focus Task
items.description:
Intent: To identify the most important task for the day
Struktur: Here’s my full to-do list for today. What’s the single most important task I should focus on, and why?
Guidelines – DO: List all tasks clearly., Ask for prioritization., Request rationale for the choice. | DONT: Leave out tasks., Be vague about the list.
Pitfalls: Ignoring the AI's suggestion., Not providing a complete list.
Quelle: Zeilenumbruch / URL: file:///C:/Users/Roland/Documents/AI/artikel/out/the-best-ai-prompts-for-busy-freelancers.txt
items.content: Here’s my full to-do list for today. What’s the single most important task I should focus on, and why?

They integrate into my systems, and I don’t fight them. </p> 96f5 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk I’ve used ChatGPT, Claude, and Notion AI for different prompts. items.content: class bf b ga gb bk class bf b bg ab dx class bf b bg ab bk class bf b bg ab dx Member-only story class ag ol href https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=medium&utm_medium=referral rel noopener ugc nofollow target _blank Unsplash 5f14 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk Ever spent more time figuring out how to email a client than doing the work? Or stared at your to-do list, paralyzed by indecision? Me too. That’s when I started using AI prompts — not as replacements, but as shortcuts to clear brain fog and reclaim an hour or two every day. 6789 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk These are the five prompts I use on repeat. Each one is built into my workflow, helps me get real work done faster, and stops me from drowning in admin. Let’s dive in. 12e8 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk You know the loop — client asks for an update, you stare at the inbox, dread setting the tone just right. Here’s the prompt that changed that: fab2 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk Every. Single. Time. It gives me a draft I can tweak, avoiding sounding robotic or too sorry. I just replace the brackets and hit send. No more second-guessing tense, tone, or clarity. Saves me at least 10 minutes I used to spend overthinking. 3692 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk Freelancers often have stellar blog content, but who has time to rewrite it for social media? That’s where this prompt comes in: c1c3 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk Past versions of me would rewrite paragraphs. Now I paste the blog link or text. ChatGPT delivers three sharp summaries I can post. Smooth, fast, and keeps the conversation going across platforms with almost zero extra effort. e8b8 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk Ever stared at Google Docs wondering which headline might actually get that click? That’s why I use this: 791c class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk Ten title choices in seconds. I pick my favorite and punch it up. But even if none work, I can riff off them. It beats a blank page any day — and I’ve seen my Medium click rate go up just by testing different styles. a04d class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk Juggling multiple gigs and side projects? I used to lose hours setting up my content calendar. Then I built this prompt: 845c class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk AI gives me a ready-made plan. I drop it into Notion or Trello and have my week laid out. I tweak as needed, but it’s a huge leap from staring at a blank calendar grid and feeling overwhelmed. 10f2 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk Reading a client’s project brief and thinking you need a translator? I’ve been there. Now I paste it and prompt: 16ff class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk Instant clarity. I copy the points into Notion or my task manager and hit the ground running. No more misread expectations or asking awkward, clarifying questions. 9445 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk I keep one final prompt in my toolbox — it’s less about output and more about focus: fbd5 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk Paste your chaos list in. The AI highlights the key task and gives a rationale. Sometimes I ignore it, but it sharpens my mental filter and helps cut out the noise. It’s a mental reset in prompt form. a1ba class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk Not all AI prompts are created equal. Generic ones like “Write a blog post” leave you with a generic copy. These work because I’ve tuned them to fit what freelancers actually do — emails, planning, messaging, and repurposing. They integrate into my systems, and I don’t fight them. 96f5 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk I’ve used ChatGPT, Claude, and Notion AI for different prompts. Each has its sweet spot: long-form brainstorming, structured summaries, or task organization. What matters is the prompt clarity and regular use. 580a class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk Every time I run these prompts, I shave off time from repetitive thinking. And for freelancers, time is literally money. 1170 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk Not everything stuck. I tried asking AI to plan my entire month with tone guides and product calendars. It generated a mess — random themes, fluff titles, inaccurate dates. I spent more time fixing it than creating from scratch. 2885 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk The lesson: keep prompts tight. High-level or vague prompts lead to high-effort editing. Your prompt should ask for a concrete deliverable you can tweak, not a generic plan you’ll ignore. Customizable, repeatable, and relevant — that’s the sweet spot. class ag ol href https://unsplash.com/?utm_source=medium&utm_medium=referral rel noopener ugc nofollow target _blank Unsplash 8e0f class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk These aren’t magic tricks. They’re just smart tools for real work. 99be class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is qf oq or iv qg ot ou fp qh ow ox fs qi oz pa fv qj pc pd pe gu bk If you’re freelancing in writing, design, marketing, or project management, these five prompts can be game changers. The trick is customizing them to your niche and using them daily until they become muscle memory. 89f6 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk So here’s the takeaway: AI won’t replace you. But if you want to reclaim your brain, speed up your day, and work smarter, let it handle the repetitive bits — and reserve your energy for the creative parts only you can do. d1a1 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk To-do lists can overwhelm, email tones can trip us up, and content repurposing can feel like extra work. These prompts don’t eliminate the work — they make it easier, faster, and more enjoyable. They give you space to breathe between deadlines. 52ca class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk Try one prompt tomorrow. Tweak it to your voice. Use it until it fits. Then try another. That’s how you turn these shortcuts into an edge. baf4 class pw-post-body-paragraph om on hy oo b is op oq or iv os ot ou fp ov ow ox fs oy oz pa fv pb pc pd pe gu bk And if you’ve got your own prompt that saves your day, drop it in the comments. Let’s help each other work smarter. class ag ol href https://medium.com/p/3aa3a3938311 rel noopener LearnAItoprofit.com class ag ah ai ee ak al am an ao ap aq ar as kb rel noopener follow href /the-900-week-secret-everyones-overlooking-313ed5ba4bf6?source=post_page---post_publication_info--1396f1065419--------------------------------------- data-discover true Last published 4 hours ago Avinash class ag ah ai ee ak al am an ao ap aq ar as kb href https://medium.com/@avi22nash/following?source=post_page---post_author_info--1396f1065419--------------------------------------- rel noopener follow 14 following

ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> Every so often, when I share a piece of work created with AI on social media, a familiar debate sparks up in the comments. “This is clever,” someone might say, “but AI can never replicate human emotion. It can’t capture the soul of a story the way a person can.” </p> <figure class =" mk ml mm mn mo mp mh mi paragraph-image "> <div role =" button " tabindex =" 0 " class =" mq mr ef ms bh mt "> <span </div> </div> </figure> <p id =" 7291 " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> And I pause. On one hand, they have a point. But on the other, I feel they might be looking at the wrong part of the picture. This whole conversation got me thinking about what truly moves us, what makes a story stick with us for years. </p> <p id =" 5417 " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> I believe human emotion isn’t driven by the tool, but by the art of storytelling itself. We remember the iconic Cadbury ad with the girl dancing on the cricket pitch not because of the film camera it was shot on, but because of the uninhibited joy it captured in its story. We remember the ‘Hamara Bajaj’ jingle because it told the story of a nation on the move. The camera, the film stock, the editing suite — those were just the vessels. The story was the soul. </p> <p id =" 33d0 " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> If those ads were to be made today, and a filmmaker chose to use AI to visualise that same, beautiful story, would it be any less impactful? I don’t think so. The day isn’t far when AI will be able to capture the subtle nuances of human emotion on screen. But to get there, we have to give it a fair chance. We have to be willing to experiment. </p> <p id =" 6eac " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> This isn’t just a hypothetical for me. A few years back, I wrote a series of short stories on sensitive social issues like child marriage and the dowry system. My dream was to turn them into short films, to give them a voice. But the reality of budgets quickly set in. Shooting in a village, managing a cast, crew, and equipment — the logistical and financial hurdles were immense. For years, those scripts sat in a folder on my computer, gathering digital dust, their stories unheard. </p> <p id =" 3cb9 " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> Then, along came AI. Suddenly, I had a way to visualise those scenes, to bring those characters to life. Is it perfect? No, not yet. There are still improvements to be made. But for the first time, those stories are moving from text on a page to a living, breathing visual. A process that was once blocked by circumstance is now possible. </p> <p id =" 8971 " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> This experience taught me something profound. We are all, in our own ways, slaves to our comfort zones. We are programmed to solve problems in a certain way because, well, that’s how it has always been done. The filmmaker in me was wired to think of cameras and crews. The programmer thinks in lines of existing code. The designer reaches for the same trusted software. </p> <p id =" ed1b " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> But the processes are changing, evolving with every passing day. Now is the time to go back to our basics. It’s time for some first-principle thinking. To take a task and ask “why?” five times, digging deeper until we hit the core reason. Is the old way truly necessary? Can this be done differently? Can a new AI tool get me to the result faster, or perhaps, in a way I never imagined? </p> <p id =" 0a60 " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> This is what I try to do almost every day. When I approach a new campaign or a creative challenge, I stop and ask myself: Why am I doing it this way? Is there another path? Am I choosing this method out of habit or out of necessity? </p> <p id =" 162d " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> The answer often lies in being willing to feel like a beginner again. To take a blank piece of paper, pick up a pencil, and be ready to write ‘A for Apple’ all over again. </p> <p id =" d3fc " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> Let’s not be afraid to unlearn. Let’s not be afraid to step out of our comfort zone and embrace the new. Because in this discomfort lies all the growth. </p> <p id =" d572 " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> Keep learning, keep growing. </p> </div> </div> </div> <div class =" ac cb nc nd ne nf " role =" separator "> <span class =" ng bx bm nh ni nj "> </span> <span class =" ng bx bm nh ni nj "> </span> <span class =" ng bx bm nh ni "> </span> </div> <div class =" fo fp fq fr fs "> <div class =" ac cb "> <div class =" ci bh fa fb fc fd "> <p id =" 16e2 " class =" pw-post-body-paragraph lj lk fv ll b lm ln lo lp lq lr ls lt lu lv lw lx ly lz ma mb mc md me mf mg fo bk "> P.S. If you’re ready to start your own journey of discovery, you can grab a copy of my book, <a class =" ag nk " href =" https://amzn.in/d/0XxyHuK " rel =" noopener ugc nofollow " target =" _blank "> <strong class =" ll fw "> Prompt DOT AI </strong> </a> . Or, if you’d like to get your team AI-ready, <a class =" ag nk " href =" https://www.linkedin.com/in/dasachin/ " rel =" noopener ugc nofollow " target =" _blank "> <strong class =" ll fw "> get in touch with me </strong> </a> . Let’s explore how this incredible new companion can change the way you work. </p> </div> </div> </div> </div> </section> </div> </div> </article> </div> <div class =" ac cb "> <div class =" ci bh fa Best AI Prompt is a First-Principle Question","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_1":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_1","name":"1e50","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"Every so often, when I share a piece of work created with AI on social media, a familiar debate sparks up in the comments. “This is clever,” someone might say, “but AI can never replicate human emotion. It can’t capture the soul of a story the way a person can.”","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"ImageMetadata:1*X0imMBoW9J-YWs8Zm4Bk5Q.jpeg":{"__typename":"ImageMetadata","id":"1*X0imMBoW9J-YWs8Zm4Bk5Q.jpeg","originalHeight":1080,"originalWidth":1920,"focusPercentX":null,"focusPercentY":null,"alt":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_2":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_2","name":"192e","type":"IMG","href":null,"layout":"INSET_CENTER","metadata":{"__ref":"ImageMetadata:1*X0imMBoW9J-YWs8Zm4Bk5Q.jpeg"},"text":"","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_3":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_3","name":"7291","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"And I pause. On one hand, they have a point. But on the other, I feel they might be looking at the wrong part of the picture. This whole conversation got me thinking about what truly moves us, what makes a story stick with us for years.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_4":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_4","name":"5417","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"I believe human emotion isn’t driven by the tool, but by the art of storytelling itself. We remember the iconic Cadbury ad with the girl dancing on the cricket pitch not because of the film camera it was shot on, but because of the uninhibited joy it captured in its story. We remember the ‘Hamara Bajaj’ jingle because it told the story of a nation on the move. The camera, the film stock, the editing suite — those were just the vessels. The story was the soul.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_5":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_5","name":"33d0","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"If those ads were to be made today, and a filmmaker chose to use AI to visualise that same, beautiful story, would it be any less impactful? I don’t think so. The day isn’t far when AI will be able to capture the subtle nuances of human emotion on screen. But to get there, we have to give it a fair chance. We have to be willing to experiment.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_6":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_6","name":"6eac","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"This isn’t just a hypothetical for me. A few years back, I wrote a series of short stories on sensitive social issues like child marriage and the dowry system. My dream was to turn them into short films, to give them a voice. But the reality of budgets quickly set in. Shooting in a village, managing a cast, crew, and equipment — the logistical and financial hurdles were immense. For years, those scripts sat in a folder on my computer, gathering digital dust, their stories unheard.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_7":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_7","name":"3cb9","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"Then, along came AI. Suddenly, I had a way to visualise those scenes, to bring those characters to life. Is it perfect? No, not yet. There are still improvements to be made. But for the first time, those stories are moving from text on a page to a living, breathing visual. A process that was once blocked by circumstance is now possible.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_8":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_8","name":"8971","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"This experience taught me something profound. We are all, in our own ways, slaves to our comfort zones. We are programmed to solve problems in a certain way because, well, that’s how it has always been done. The filmmaker in me was wired to think of cameras and crews. The programmer thinks in lines of existing code. The designer reaches for the same trusted software.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_9":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_9","name":"ed1b","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"But the processes are changing, evolving with every passing day. Now is the time to go back to our basics. It’s time for some first-principle thinking. To take a task and ask “why?” five times, digging deeper until we hit the core reason. Is the old way truly necessary? Can this be done differently? Can a new AI tool get me to the result faster, or perhaps, in a way I never imagined?","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_10":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_10","name":"0a60","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"This is what I try to do almost every day. When I approach a new campaign or a creative challenge, I stop and ask myself: Why am I doing it this way? Is there another path? Am I choosing this method out of habit or out of necessity?","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_11":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_11","name":"162d","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"The answer often lies in being willing to feel like a beginner again. To take a blank piece of paper, pick up a pencil, and be ready to write ‘A for Apple’ all over again.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_12":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_12","name":"d3fc","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"Let’s not be afraid to unlearn. Let’s not be afraid to step out of our comfort zone and embrace the new. Because in this discomfort lies all the growth.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_13":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_13","name":"d572","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"Keep learning, keep growing.","hasDropCap":null,"dropCapImage":null,"markups":[],"codeBlockMetadata":null,"iframe":null,"mixtapeMetadata":null},"Paragraph:9c4a56c05f05_14":{"__typename":"Paragraph","id":"9c4a56c05f05_14","name":"16e2","type":"P","href":null,"layout":null,"metadata":null,"text":"P.S. If you’re ready to start your own journey of discovery, you can grab a copy of my book, Prompt DOT AI. Or, if you’d like to get your team AI-ready, get in touch with me.
